name: Iqra Fund
mission: Iqra Fund provides preschool programs for communities to teach children ages four to six years old basic language, social, and formal learning skills to help them succeed in primary school.
programs: Access to Higher Education and Career Pathways
theoryOfChange: Iqra Fund explicitly states its Theory of Change on its 'Our Model' page. The core idea is that 'if girls have an education, communities thrive, nations flourish, and overall planetary health improves.' This is further elaborated by their strategic priorities: Community Engagement, Teacher Training & Development, Learning Environments, Student Success, and Access to Higher Education and Career Pathways. Their impact reports also reference and are guided by this Theory of Change, emphasizing 'A Girl's Education. A Community's Future. A Global Effect.'

evaluationSources: Government Recognition for Community Schools (Government of Pakistan)

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.iqrafund.org/donate (Source: https://www.iqrafund.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 34/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

score_details.score_summary: Iqra Fund shows exceptional impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.iqrafund.org/donate (Source: https://www.iqrafund.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The charity has a 100.0/100 score and a fundraising efficiency of $0.07 per $1 raised.
Total revenue is $991,974 and the program expense ratio is 85.9%.
The organization provides tuition assistance and employs program staff in the region.
The charity supports girls in primary through secondary school and increases village enrollment rates.
The charity provides various donation options for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Iqra Fund earns a high overall score due to its perfect financial transparency rating and efficient use of capital, with nearly 86% of revenue directed toward educational programs.
areas_for_improvement: Expanding the donor base to increase total annual revenue beyond $991,974
Increasing public disclosure of specific regional impact metrics in annual reports

dimension_explanations.alignment: Iqra Fund is highly aligned with donors seeking to address global education urgency, particularly for marginalized girls [8]. The organization is Zakat-eligible, providing a verified pathway for Muslim donors to fulfill their charitable obligations through educational empowerment [2][10].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through a capacity-building model that prepares young children for formal schooling and supports girls through secondary education [5][8]. With a total revenue of $991,974 and a program expense ratio of 85.9%, the charity maintains a lean operation where fundraising costs are only $0.07 per $1 raised [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: Iqra Fund empowers underserved communities through comprehensive educational support and high-impact preschool programs.
strengths: Exceptional financial efficiency with a 100.100.0/100 from Charity Navigator rating
High program expense ratio of 85.9% ensuring funds reach beneficiaries
Strong focus on long-term capacity building through teacher professional development
baseline_narrative.summary: Iqra Fund provides critical educational infrastructure, including preschool programs for children ages four to six and secondary school support for girls [3][5]. The organization maintains a perfect Charity Navigator score of 100.0/100, reflecting its commitment to transparency and financial health [1].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Iqra Fund earns a high overall score due to its perfect financial transparency rating and efficient use of capital, with nearly 86% of revenue directed toward educational programs.

areas_for_improvement.context: While highly efficient, the organization's <cite id="3">$991,974 in total revenue</cite> limits its overall reach compared to larger international NGOs.
The charity's <cite id="3">85.9% program expense ratio</cite> is slightly below the <cite id="1">89.6% peer program ratio median</cite> for global education charities.

bbb_assessment.summary: Strong governance indicators with a 20-member board and high transparency.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains excellent financial health with 6.8 months of working capital, ensuring stability despite its smaller size.
risk_factors: <cite id="3">Total revenue under $1 million</cite> limits operational scale
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the organization's relatively small scale, with <cite id="3">$991,974 in total revenue</cite>, which may restrict its ability to respond to large-scale systemic educational crises compared to larger peers.

confidence.data_freshness: Data primarily from 2023 Form 990 and recent ratings
confidence.notes: High confidence due to consistent reporting across IRS filings and Charity Navigator.

alignment.explanation: The organization is highly aligned with Muslim donor priorities as a <cite id="2">ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE</cite> charity operating in Muslim-majority regions like Pakistan.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Iqra Fund due to its <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid, indicating high levels of public disclosure.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, the organization could publish more detailed, third-party impact evaluations of its educational outcomes.

impact.explanation: The charity delivers strong impact with an <cite id="3">85.9% program expense ratio</cite> and an estimated <cite id="4">$138.09 cost per beneficiary</cite>, utilizing a capacity-building delivery model.
impact.improvement: Impact could be strengthened by increasing the program expense ratio closer to the <cite id="1">89.6% peer program ratio median</cite>.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes and strong theory of change

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct implementation of educational programs and tuition assistance.

rich_narrative.headline: Iqra Fund empowers underserved communities through comprehensive educational support and high-impact preschool programs.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support highly efficient, targeted educational initiatives for children and girls in rural Pakistan using zakat-eligible funds.
donor_motivations: Desire to fund early childhood and girls' education in Muslim-majority regions
Preference for highly efficient organizations with low fundraising costs
Want to fulfill zakat obligations through educational capacity building
giving_considerations: Smaller organizational scale means donations can have a significant proportional impact
Focus is geographically concentrated in Pakistan
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking to fund large-scale emergency humanitarian relief or those looking for domestic US educational programs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks specific outcome metrics and maintains a strong, documented theory of change, though it lacks large-scale RCTs.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Iqra Fund aims to implement programs that serve as a model for creating access to high-quality education by removing barriers and building local capacity.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Tracking educational outcomes ensures that tuition assistance and teacher training translate into actual learning improvements and higher enrollment rates.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With revenue under $1M and a highly efficient delivery model, the organization has significant room to absorb additional funding to scale its rural education programs.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a highly targeted focus on rural Pakistan and an exceptional <cite id="1">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite> fundraising efficiency.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Larger scale organization with a similar K-12 education focus in Pakistan.
similar_organizations.name: Developments in Literacy

similar_organizations.differentiator: Significantly larger organization operating a massive network of purpose-built schools.
similar_organizations.name: The Citizens Foundation USA

similar_organizations.differentiator: Broader scope including vocational training alongside educational programs.
similar_organizations.name: The Noor Project

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="3">85.9% program expense ratio</cite> and spends only <cite id="1">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite>.
Iqra Fund holds a <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> across all beacon metrics.
The organization achieves a highly efficient <cite id="4">$138.09 cost per beneficiary</cite> in its global education programs.

strengths_deep_dive: Iqra Fund demonstrates a strong commitment to maximizing donor impact through its lean operational model. With <cite id="3">$991,974 in total revenue</cite>, the charity successfully channels <cite id="3">84.7% to program expenses</cite>. This financial discipline is recognized by independent evaluators, as evidenced by its <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid. Furthermore, the organization's fundraising efficiency is exceptional, requiring only <cite id="1">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite> to sustain its operations.
rich_narrative.summary: Iqra Fund is a <cite id="2">ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE</cite> organization established in <cite id="4">2011</cite> that focuses on providing educational access to underserved communities, primarily in Pakistan. The organization operates with <cite id="3">$991,974 in total revenue</cite> and demonstrates strong financial efficiency by dedicating <cite id="3">84.7% to program expenses</cite>. Iqra Fund has earned a <cite id="1">100/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting exceptional accountability and financial health. The charity's programs include early childhood education, teacher training, and secondary school support, operating with a highly efficient fundraising model that costs just <cite id="1">$0.07 per $1 raised</cite>.
